Every year,

🚨 800+ million people go hungry
🚨 600 million fall ill from eating contaminated food

tweet_text:
Henrietta Lacks' cells, also known as #HeLaCells, became the first “immortal” cell line, allowing numerous scientific breakthroughs.
Shockingly, the global scientific community once hid her race & true story from the world, a historic wrong that today’s recognition seeks to heal. https://t.co/DfTbq2vUlp https://t.co/QuiAICNWeE
text_en: Henrietta Lacks' cells, also known as , became the first immortal cell line, allowing numerous scientific breakthroughs.Shockingly, the global scientific community once hid her race & true story from the world, a historic wrong that todays recognition seeks to heal.

tweet_text:
Henrietta Lacks died of cervical cancer, 70 years ago, on 4 October 1951.
Taken without her consent, her cells have allowed incalculable scientific breakthroughs such as HPV & polio vaccines and #COVID19 research https://t.co/vVx1Hn52lO https://t.co/0olbIDdKwh
text_en: Henrietta Lacks died of cervical cancer, years ago, on October .Taken without her consent, her cells have allowed incalculable scientific breakthroughs such as HPV & polio vaccines and research

tweet_text:
Thank you, Henrietta Lacks!
Today @DrTedros honoured Henrietta Lacks posthumously with a WHO Director-General’s award, acknowledging her story - one of inequity - and recognizing her world-changing legacy to science and health https://t.co/vVx1Hn52lO https://t.co/rshT1shwfn
text_en: Thank you, Henrietta Lacks!Today honoured Henrietta Lacks posthumously with a WHO Director-Generals award, acknowledging her story - one of inequity - and recognizing her world-changing legacy to science and health

tweet_text: @DrTedros "It is therefore my great honour to present the Director-General’s Award posthumously to Henrietta Lacks. I invite her son, Mr Lawrence Lacks, and her great granddaughter, Victoria Baptiste, to receive it on her behalf"-@DrTedros https://t.co/DUDx6XSPS6
text_en: "It is therefore my great honour to present the Director-Generals Award posthumously to Henrietta Lacks. I invite her son, Mr Lawrence Lacks, and her great granddaughter, Victoria Baptiste, to receive it on her behalf"-

tweet_text: "Today is also an opportunity to recognize those women of colour who have made incredible – but often unseen – contributions to medical science"-@DrTedros
text_en: "Today is also an opportunity to recognize those women of colour who have made incredible but often unseen contributions to medical science"-

tweet_text: @DrTedros "We stand in solidarity with marginalized patients and communities all over the world who are not consulted, engaged or empowered in their own care. We affirm that in medicine and in science, #BlackLivesMatter. Henrietta Lacks’s life mattered, and still matters"-@DrTedros
text_en: "We stand in solidarity with marginalized patients and communities all over the world who are not consulted, engaged or empowered in their own care. We affirm that in medicine and in science, . Henrietta Lackss life mattered, and still matters"-

tweet_text: "Acknowledging the wrongs of the past is essential for building trust for the future. We also recognize the extraordinary potential that her legacy continues to offer. There are many more lives we can save by working for racial justice and equity"-@DrTedros
text_en: "Acknowledging the wrongs of the past is essential for building trust for the future. We also recognize the extraordinary potential that her legacy continues to offer. There are many more lives we can save by working for racial justice and equity"-

tweet_text: "But the end does not justify the means. All it would have taken was for someone to do her the honour of asking. In honouring Henrietta Lacks today, WHO acknowledges the importance of reckoning with past injustices, and advancing racial equity in health and science"-@DrTedros
text_en: "But the end does not justify the means. All it would have taken was for someone to do her the honour of asking. In honouring Henrietta Lacks today, WHO acknowledges the importance of reckoning with past injustices, and advancing racial equity in health and science"-

tweet_text: "Many people have benefited from those #HeLaCells – fortunes have been made, science has advanced, Nobel Prizes have been won and most importantly, many lives have been saved. No doubt Henrietta would have been pleased that her suffering has saved others"-@DrTedros
text_en: "Many people have benefited from those fortunes have been made, science has advanced, Nobel Prizes have been won and most importantly, many lives have been saved. No doubt Henrietta would have been pleased that her suffering has saved others"-

tweet_text: "Likewise, although her cells have been used in #COVID19 research, the tools to stop the disease are not being shared enough with low-and-middle-income countries. Nor are many other life-saving innovations developed with Henrietta’s miraculous #HeLacells"-@DrTedros
text_en: "Likewise, although her cells have been used in research, the tools to stop the disease are not being shared enough with low-and-middle-income countries. Nor are many other life-saving innovations developed with Henriettas miraculous "-

tweet_text: "Henrietta’s cells were foundational in the development of #HPV vaccines that can eliminate the same cancer that took her life. But in countries with the highest burden of cervical cancer, those vaccines are not available in sufficient doses"-@DrTedros #cervicalcancer
text_en: "Henriettas cells were foundational in the development of vaccines that can eliminate the same cancer that took her life. But in countries with the highest burden of cervical cancer, those vaccines are not available in sufficient doses"-

tweet_text: "3️⃣ the medical technologies that were developed from this injustice have been used to perpetuate further injustice, because they have not been shared equitably around the world"-@DrTedros
text_en: "3 the medical technologies that were developed from this injustice have been used to perpetuate further injustice, because they have not been shared equitably around the world"-

tweet_text: "2️⃣ Henrietta Lacks was exploited. She is one of many women of colour whose bodies have been misused by science. She placed her trust in the health system so she could receive treatment. But the system took something from her without her knowledge or consent"-@DrTedros
text_en: "2 Henrietta Lacks was exploited. She is one of many women of colour whose bodies have been misused by science. She placed her trust in the health system so she could receive treatment. But the system took something from her without her knowledge or consent"-

tweet_text:
"What happened to Henrietta was wrong, for at least three reasons.   
1️⃣ she lived in a time when racial discrimination was legal in her society. Racial discrimination may no longer be legal most countries, but it is still widespread in many countries"-@DrTedros
text_en: "What happened to Henrietta was wrong, for at least three reasons. she lived in a time when racial discrimination was legal in her society. Racial discrimination may no longer be legal most countries, but it is still widespread in many countries"-

tweet_text: @DrTedros "The story of Henrietta Lacks and her @LacksFamily has been told in different ways by different people. Many sought to hide or alter things about her: her race; her name; her identity"-@DrTedros
text_en: "The story of Henrietta Lacks and her has been told in different ways by different people. Many sought to hide or alter things about her: her race; her name; her identity"-
